I.  INTRODUCTION 
 
1.  The Government of the People’s Republic of China (PRC) requested knowledge and 
support technical assistance (TA) from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to strengthen the 
design of an integrated, sustainable, and innovative transport plan for the Xiong’an New Area. 
The TA will provide good practice recommendations on transport policies and support knowledge 
sharing activities with the aim to develop Xiong’an into a green, modern, and technologically 
advanced district. 
 
2.  The TA is included in ADB’s country operations business plan (2018–2020) for the PRC.1 
The TA supports the operational priorities of ADB’s Strategy 2030 to (i) making cities more livable, 
and  (ii)  tackling  climate  change,  building  climate  and  disaster  resilience,  and  enhancing 
environmental sustainability.2 
 
II.  ISSUES 
 
3.  Established in 2017, Xiong’an covers the counties of Xiong, Rongcheng, and Anxin in 
Hebei province, 150 kilometers (km) southwest of Beijing. With an estimated population of 
1 million, the area has low-intensity, high-concentration, and labor-intensive development such 
as garment, shoe, and plastics manufacturing. Low-technology light industry is the main economic 
driver contributing to more than 50% of gross domestic product (GDP), while agricultural activities 
contribute 20%. The average per capita GDP is CNY19,200, which is below the average GDP in 
Hebei province.  
 
4.  Xiong’an will support the noncapital functions of the central government in Beijing. With 
plans to attract international and national resources and set up research centers focusing on 
advance technology (such as artificial intelligence, big data, cloud technology, e-commerce, and 
biomedical research), Xiong’an is set to become the incubation center for future technological 
development (such as quantum communication, stem cell research, and nanomaterials). 
 
5.  Xiong’an has limited road and rail links. Four airports serve the area—the nearest is the 
new Beijing airport (about 100 km away) and the remaining three are 140–170 km away. Xiong’an 
lacks the connectivity and transport infrastructure required to carry out and sustain its expected 
functions. With the projected movement of people and industries into Xiong’an, the existing 
transport capacity will not be enough to support mobility in the area. 
 
6.  The overall planning framework for Xiong’an was disclosed to the public in April 2018.3 
Based on its development objectives and indicators, detailed plans have been prepared and 
policy design to attract the necessary human resources and move the noncapital functions of 
Beijing has started. In 2019, planning work for Xiong’an will continue with a focus on attracting 
innovative and high-technology businesses into the area. By 2020, the development plan for 
Xiong’an  will  be  finalized  and  the  initial  framework  and  setup  of  the  advance  technology 
businesses will be completed. 
 
                                                 
1  ADB. 2018. Country Operations Business Plan: People’s Republic of China, 2018–2020. Manila. The TA first 
appeared in the business opportunities section of ADB’s website on 29 October 2018. 
2  ADB. 2018. Strategy 2030: Achieving a Prosperous, Inclusive, Resilient, and Sustainable Asia and the Pacific. 
Manila. 
3  Hebei Provincial Government. 2018. Hebei Xiong'an New District Planning Outline. Hebei.

2 
7.  Urban transport planning (as well as urban spatial and land use planning) and urban 
infrastructure construction are supervised by different public agencies in the PRC. The Xiong’an 
Planning and Construction Bureau oversees the planning and coordination of agencies. 
 
8.  Transport forms an important part of this new area development. To ensure that the area 
will be livable and accessible with high-quality and sustainable infrastructure, land use and 
transport plans should be well coordinated. The transport plan should contain elements of 
accessibility, mobility, and innovation that are at par with international standards and best practice. 
An integrated and sustainable transportation development for Xiong’an will promote sustainable 
urban development, decrease emissions, reduce transport safety incidents, reduce congestion, 
and increase attractiveness and competitiveness for residents and businesses.  
 
9.  The Ministry of Transport (MOT) provides guidance and support on the development of 
the sustainable transport plan and interregional linkages in the Beijing–Tianjin–Hebei region and 
neighboring cities. MOT also provides technical and capacity development support on transport-
related matters for Xiong’an. 
 
III.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Impact and Outcome 
 
10.  The TA is aligned with the following impact: sustainable transport development realized.4 
The TA will have the following outcome: an integrated, sustainable, and innovative transport 
development plan strengthened.5 
 
B.  Outputs, Methods, and Activities 
 
11.  Output 1: Knowledge support on integrated, sustainable, and innovative transport 
plan for Xiong’an provided. Output 1 will provide the tools for policy makers and planners to 
develop Xiong’an into a green, modern, and smart city. The output will be delivered via study 
reports, two workshops, and one seminar. 
(i)  Output 1a: Recommendations on transport development planning will be provided 
based on international experience and perspectives. Areas of recommendation will 
include  
(a)  integrated and inclusive infrastructure (e.g., transport network, regional 
connectivity, and passenger terminals and freight hubs layout);  
(b)  user-oriented services (e.g., personalized services that provide comfort, 
convenience, and safety for passengers, and economical and efficient 
services for freight);  
(c)  innovative  technologies  (e.g.,  intelligent  transport  systems,  connected 
vehicles,  autonomous  vehicles,  shared  mobility,  3D  printing,6 drone,7 
modern travel demand modeling simulation8); and 
(d)  Green transport (e.g., new energy technologies that reduce emissions for 
private and public transport, including land and water transport).  
                                                 
4  State Council. 2017. Announcement of the establishment of Xiong’an new area in Hebei. 7th Conference of Beijing–
Tianjin–Hebei Coordinated Development Leading Group. Beijing. 
5  The design and monitoring framework is in Appendix 1. 
6  3D printing focusing on advantages, application areas, policy requirements, and technology needed.  
7  Drone-based  remote-sensing  capabilities  for  traffic  management,  logistics  management,  and  infrastructure 
inspections. 
8  Travel demand forecasting model simulations for shared mobility and demand-responsive applications.

3 
 
(ii)  Output 1b: Knowledge gained from the results of the study will be shared through 
different stages of the TA implementation, which will include two workshops, one 
regional seminar, and a knowledge product. The workshops and seminar will be 
attended by the TA steering committee comprising members from Xiong’an, the 
Ministry  of  Transport,  research  institutes,  and  stakeholders  working  on  the 
Xiong’an development plan. 
 
12.  Output 2: Pilot demonstration of an innovative technology showcased. Based on the 
findings of output 1, consultations with stakeholders, and the finalization of the Xiong’an transport 
plan, appropriate pilot project(s) may be identified and implemented. The pilot demonstration of 
selected project(s) will feature the current state-of-the-art high-level technology available, which 
is aligned with Xiong’an’s development objectives. Funding of the pilot project(s) may be identified 
within the existing TA or outside source(s). 
 
13.  Output 3: Institutional framework and organizational structure recommendations 
provided. To achieve a holistic and sustainable transport development in Xiong’an, a fresh 
perspective of institutional framework and organizational structure will need to be established. 
Recommendations on how to integrate and coordinate different government, civil society, and 
private sector functions for transport planning and operations will be designed to meet the long-
term development objectives of Xiong’an. Output 3 will be delivered jointly with output 1 through 
study reports, workshops, and a seminar.  
 
C.  Cost and Financing 
 
14.  The TA is estimated to cost $440,000, of which $400,000 will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF–other sources). The key expenditure items 
are listed in Appendix 2.  
 
15.  The government will provide counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff, office, 
and other in-kind contributions. 
 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
16.  ADB  will  administer  the  TA.  ADB’s  Sustainable  Infrastructure  Division,  East  Asia 
Department will select a consulting firm and national consultants for the TA and supervise and 
evaluate the outputs. The Comprehensive Planning Department of the Ministry of Transport will 
be the executing agency, which will (i) provide counterpart project management support and carry 
out day-to-day TA activities, such as overseeing the TA consultants’ work; (ii) organize peer 
reviews and comments on consultants’ reports; (iii) organize TA review workshops, seminar, and 
stakeholder meetings; and (iv) disseminate knowledge gained to related agencies and incorporate 
in documents. The implementation arrangements are summarized in the table.

4 
Implementation Arrangements 
Aspects  Arrangements 
Indicative implementation period  15 December 2018–March 2020 
Executing agency  Comprehensive Planning Department, Ministry of Transport 
Consultants  To be selected and engaged by ADB 
QCBS (90:10)  Consulting firm  $315,000 
  Individual: ICS  National expertise  $85,000 
(11 person-months) 
Disbursement  The TA resources will be disbursed following ADB's Technical Assistance 
Disbursement Handbook (2010, as amended from time to time). 
ADB = Asian Development Bank, ICS = individual consultant system, QCBS = quality- and cost- based selection, TA 
= technical assistance. 
Sources: Asian Development Bank.  
 
17.  Consulting services. The TA will be implemented over 15 months, tentatively from 
15 December 2018 to 30 March 2020. A consulting firm and a three of national consultants will 
be engaged by ADB in accordance with ADB’s Procurement Policy (2017, as amended from time 
to time) and its associated project administration instructions and/or staff instructions.9 
 
18.  Pilot testing of project approach. The exact scope of the pilot testing will be determined 
based on the recommendations in output 1, and consultation with the stakeholders. Pilot testing 
will demonstrate the use of high-level technology that can benefit Xiong’an, with the potential to 
expand the scope. The selected pilot demonstration will not result in any adverse environment 
and/or social impacts. The pilot testing will be administered by ADB unless otherwise specified. 
Any procurement and recruitment of consultants will follow ADB’s Procurement Policy and its 
associated project administration instructions and/or staff instructions. 
 
IV.  THE PRESIDENT'S DECISION 
 
19.  The President, acting under the authority delegated by the Board, has approved the 
provision of technical assistance not exceeding the equivalent of $400,000 on a grant basis to the 
Government of the People’s Republic of China for the Policy Study on Integrated Transport 
Development in Xiong'an New Area from an International Perspective, and hereby reports this 
action to the Board. 
 
 
 
 
 
                                                 
9  Terms of Reference for Consultants (accessible from the list of linked documents in Appendix 3).

Key Activities with Milestones 
1.  Knowledge support on integrated, sustainable, and innovative transport plan for Xiong’an 
provided 
1.1 Undertake the review of best practice studies from international and national examples (Q2 2019–
Q3 2019)  
1.2 Conduct consultation and information dissemination to stakeholders (Q2 2019–Q4 2019) 
1.3 Organize first workshop on best practices (Q2 2019)  
1.4 Prepare Xiong’an transport development recommendations (Q3 2019–Q4 2019) 
1.5 Organize second workshop on recommendations (Q4 2019) 
1.6 Draft knowledge product on integrated, sustainable, and innovative transport development for 
Xiong’an (Q3 2019–Q1 2020)  
1.7 Organize seminar to disseminate Xiong’an transport development (Q1 2020) 
2.   Pilot demonstration of an innovative technology showcased 
2.1 Based on the results of output 1, identify and select an appropriate project for the pilot demonstration 
(Q3 2019–Q4 2019) 
2.2 Prepare and develop the implementation plan for the pilot project (Q3 2019–Q4 2019) 
2.3 Implement the pilot project (Q4 2019–Q1 2020) 
 
3.   Institutional framework and organizational structure recommendations provided 
3.1 Undertake a review of different organizations and ministries involved in the planning of Xiong’an  
  (Q2 2019) 
3.2 Conduct consultation and information dissemination to stakeholders (Q3 2019–Q1 2020) 
3.3 Develop recommendations on government function integration for transport planning in Xiong’an  
  (Q4 2019–Q1 2020) 
 
TA Management Activities 
1.  Confirm stakeholder consultation group including Xiong’an Planning and Construction Bureau by 
January 2019 
2.  Mobilize all team of consultants by March 2019 
3.  Prepare draft inception report with detailed work plan by April 2019 
4.  Prepare interim report and conduct interim workshop by June 2019 
5.  Prepare draft final recommendation reports by December 2019 
6.  Conduct knowledge sharing workshop by December 2019 
7.  Prepare draft knowledge product by December 2019 
8.  Conduct seminar by February 2020 
9.  Select and implement the pilot project by March 2020 
10. Submit final knowledge product and reports by March 2020  
 
Inputs 
ADB: $400,000 (Technical Assistance Special Fund – Others)  
Note: The government will provide counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff, office 
accommodation, and other in-kind contributions.
